text: [Music]
hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with cherry pie with almond crumb
topping that's right
she's my cherry pie and i'm not talking
about the worst rock song ever written
I'm talking about this amazingly
delicious single crust crumb topped
cherry pie which is really just a
vanilla ice cream topping disguised as a
pie but anyway we'll get to that for now
here's how you do it so we're gonna
start with the crumb and topping because
we want to refrigerate this before we
crumble it over the pie so we're gonna
start with some rolled oats some
slivered almonds some brown sugar some
salt and some flour alright so those are
the dry ingredients we're gonna mix that
together I'm not really sure why I could
have just dumped the butter in but I
decided for no apparent reason to stir
it with a spoon I expect you to do the
same and then we're gonna dump in some
cold diced up butter so take it right
out of the fridge cut it in small pieces
throw it in I'm gonna give that a stir
just to coat it with the flour because
what we're gonna do is we're gonna get
in here with our fingertips and we're
gonna rub in the butter now the shortcut
method here is just to melt the butter
and mix it all together which we've done
before for different fruit crumbles but
there's something about mixing it in
with your fingertips like this and not
melting the butter that I think makes a
nicer crumb topping so just get in there
kind of break up the butter with your
fingertips and when it kind of looks
like cookie dough you're done so when it
looks like that I'm gonna go ahead and
put some plastic wrap on it throw that
in the fridge while you get the rest of
your stuff together
alright so that's done and it's on to
the cherry filling I got a couple pounds
of beautiful sweet fresh cherries those
have been pitted of course I used two
cherry pitter which I highly recommend
to that we're gonna add the juice of
half a lemon some sugar now the amount
of sugar depends on how sweet the
cherries are but you'll read about that
on the blog post after the sugar we're
gonna add some cornstarch and we're
gonna mix that for basically three or
four minutes until the cornstarch and
the sugar kind of dissolve into those
cherry juices if you can still feel lots
of grains of sugar and see dry powdery
cornstarch just keep mixing it and it's
gonna look something like that alright
once that set we're onto our pie crust
which is a single pie crust and of
course we're using our famous pie dough
recipe you can tell that's totally not a
frozen show
because of all the imperfections which
make it perfect we're gonna go ahead and
dump in our cherries and of course every
single drop of that sir P liquid in the
bowl
alright even those out as best you can
give it a gentle tap down with a spatula
by the way that is not the old tap a
tappa so don't get all excited and once
that's done you're gonna pull your crumb
topping out of the fridge and just
crumble it over the top all right so
some people call this a streusel topping
a crisp top a crumble top there's so
many names but we're just gonna go with
crumb topping because it's simple like
us definitely gonna put that on a sheet
pan with some foil on it in case we have
any bubble overs and then we're gonna
pop that in a preheated 350 degree oven
for about an hour and 15 minutes our
you're gonna be the judge and what
you're looking for is something that's
well browned and bubbling
enthusiastically
so it's gonna look like that we're gonna
pull that out and yes you know what's
coming next
let this cool completely if you serve
this now you're not gonna be serving
cherry pie you're gonna be serving hot
cherry soup and you know what doesn't
sound good hot cherry soup so don't do
that let this cool down to room
temperature and then refrigerate until
thoroughly chilled it is a much much
better texture and flavor cold then warm
of course you're gonna serve this
adjacent to some delicious vanilla bean
ice cream and there you go cherry pie
and iconic summer classic look at that
and this is a very simple version one
crust by the way half the work of two
crusts but we're not missing out on
anything because that almond crumb
topping is very very delicious and a
perfect partner both flavor-wise and
texture-wise amazing cherries and like I
said earlier this is really just the
world's best ice cream topping disguised
as a pie the way that creamy vanilla ice
cream works with the cherry and the
almond it's just such a perfect bite so
I really hope you give this a try head
over to food wishes calm for all the
ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
you
